sub_title: Erasmus Mundus Master's in International Law of Global Security, Peace and Development (ILGSPD) | Human Rights Advocacy | International Law | Policy Researcher | Monitoring and Evaluation
summary:
As a young yet experienced human rights lawyer, researcher, and policy analyst, I bring a decade of expertise acquired through diverse channels: youth-led initiatives, academic projects, and professional roles.

My skill set spans public policy monitoring, human rights research, and legal assistance, with recent engagements in international and EU policy domains. I possess deep knowledge of international law, EU law, immigration law, migration integration policies, gender equity, humanitarian law, corporate governance, and intersectionality.

My journey has nurtured my cultural sensitivity and a strong commitment to collaboration across diverse backgrounds and stakeholders.

With an academic foundation in Law, International Security, and Political Sciences, I approach projects with a multidisciplinary perspective.

My mission is clear: to apply my skills and knowledge to drive positive societal change, working towards a more just and equitable world. Let's connect and explore ways to advance human rights and social justice together.

Email: amandafilas@gmail.com

Location: Current based in the Netherlands, but working remotely across borders and ready to reallocate for the right opportunity.

profile_positions.location: City of Glasgow, Escócia, Reino Unido
profile_positions.description: Full Scholarship holder at the Erasmus Mundus Master in International Law of Global Security, Peace and Development (ILGSPD) programme.
profile_positions.title: Scholarship Holder

profile_positions.description:
- Conducted data analysis, literature review, and desk research on migrants' mental health vulnerabilities in Ireland resulting in the production of the "Mental Health Research Report for IOM Ireland AVR Programming".
- Analysed and synthesised complex research findings, highlighting key issues and trends related to migration and mental health vulnerabilities, as well as gender-based vulnerabilities.
profile_positions.title: Policy Researcher

company.name: Defensoria Pública do Estado do Paraná

profile_positions.company: Defensoria Pública do Estado do Paraná
profile_positions.description: Traineeship at the Center for Citizenship and Human Rights (NUCIDH) of the Public Defender's Office of the State of Paraná, in Brazil. Strategical action in demands related to the defence of human rights, especially related to the homeless population rights, cases of abuse of the police force, and demands related to health protection during the COVID-19 pandemic.
profile_positions.title: Human Rights Trainee

company.name: Ministério Público do Estado do Paraná

profile_positions.company: Ministério Público do Estado do Paraná
profile_positions.description:
Traineeship at the Human Rights Center of the Public Prosecution Service of the State of Paraná (MPPR), in Brazil. Technical and legal support to prosecutors in social demands related to human rights, specifically: homeless people's rights, the human right to adequate food, social work, traditional/tribal communities’ rights. 

▪ Identifying, monitoring and reporting human rights violations. 
▪ Follow-up of meetings and plenary sessions of human rights councils.
▪ Public policy monitoring.
▪ Preparation of consultations and technical notes.
▪ Human rights case-based research.
▪ Combating violence against homeless people.
▪ Production of reports on public policies and emergency aid related to COVID-19.
profile_positions.title: Human Rights Trainee

profile_positions.company: Ministério Público do Estado do Paraná
profile_positions.description:
Internship at the Human Rights Center of the Public Prosecution Service of the State of Paraná (MPPR), in Brazil. Technical and legal support to prosecutors in social demands related to human rights, specifically: gender equality and women’s rights, LGBTQ+ rights, land policy and agrarian reform. 

▪ Monitoring cases of gender-based violence and LGBTQ+ discrimination.
▪ Follow-up of meetings of networks for the defence of women's and LGBTQ+ rights. 
▪ Monitoring legal suits on land conflicts.
▪ Case-based research.
profile_positions.title: Human Rights Intern

profile_positions.description:
Participant of the university outreach project "EKOA - Environmental law for all", focused on promoting dialogue and collective knowledge construction about social and environmental legislation with small farmers and traditional (tribal) communities.

Main activities: research development, organization of meetings, gathering demands with traditional communities.

Subjects: environmental law; human rights; law education.
profile_positions.title: Project Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Intern at the Legal and Compliance Department. 

▪ Main activities: legal support to the attorneys in preparation of corporate documents, contracts analysis and writing, litigation monitoring.

Subjects: contract law; governance; labour law; corporate law.
profile_positions.title: Legal Department Intern

profile_positions.description: - Tutored students in Legal Anthropology (volunteer work).
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Intern at the Legal, Compliance and Risk Department.

▪ Main activities: legal support to the attorneys in preparation of corporate documents, contract
analysis/writing, litigation monitoring, risk reports writing.

Subjects: contract law; governance; labour law; corporate law.
profile_positions.title: Legal Department Intern

company.name: Defensoria Pública do Estado do Paraná

profile_positions.company: Defensoria Pública do Estado do Paraná
profile_positions.description:
Intern at the Interdisciplinary Assistance Center.

▪ Activities: legal and technical support to public defenders in legal free assistance to vulnerable people, preparation of petitions and preparation of other legal documents.

Subjects: family law, civil law, criminal law, constitutional law.
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern

profile_positions.description:
Match Coordinator (volunteer) of the Incoming Global Community Development Programme.

▪ Main activities: recruitment of international volunteers for projects at AIESEC in Curitiba; partnerships with other AIESEC offices around the world; support about the documentation for visa and entry in Brazil for the participants.
profile_positions.title: Match Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Project Manager (volunteer) of the "Earth Charter" AIESEC national project, which aimed to share
content from the Earth Charter among youths in Brazil.

▪ Main activities: team leadership, conducting partnership with schools, dissemination of the project among AIESEC community, recruitment of international volunteers, progress monitoring. Leading 20 international volunteers, operations in about 20 schools.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

volunteer_experiences.description: Volunteer researcher to prof. Tineke Strik, a Member of the European Parliament, on the EU-Turkey migration agreement.
Non-profit project that aims to act in a comprehensive, empowering and political way, supporting and targeting the visibility of the homeless population of Curitiba.

Member of the Center for Studies in Human Rights Systems (NESIDH), from the Federal University of Paraná. The group is organized into four pillars: research, competitions and simulations, advocacy, and organization of events. As a NESIDH member, my main activities were (beyond research):

▪ Event organizer of the “V Pre-Moot of Human Rights”, a simulation of the Inter-American Court of Human Rights. 
▪ Responsible for logistics of the “IV Pre-Moot of Human Rights” event, a simulation of the Inter-American Court of Human Rights, which happened in April 2019 and had 18 participating teams from several Brazilian universities.
▪ Event organizer of the “Human Rights Professions” seminar, held at the headquarters of the Faculty of Law of the Federal University of Paraná, with about 60 participants. September 2018.
▪ Speaker of the Federal University of Paraná team at the "III Pre-Moot of Human Rights", a human rights moot court competition held at the headquarters of the Federal University of Paraná. Hypothetical case: "Maria Helena Quispe and Mônica Quispe vs. the Republic of Naira". April 2018.
▪ Speaker (Argentine Representative) at the "II Model of the UN Human Rights Council", held at the UN Brazil headquarters, in Brasília, Brazil. October 2017.

Volunteer at the university outreach project "Clinic of access to justice and education in prisons (CAJEP)" (also called "Deprivation of Freedom and Access to Justice"), promoted by the Center of Legal Practices.
▪ Main activities: Free legal aid for prisoners, with visits to prisons and preparation of legal documents.

Volunteer teacher at the Project “Preparing children for the future”, from Furukawa Electric LatAm.
▪ Main activities: providing free tutoring in Portuguese, literature and writing in order to help children coming from poor families in school and to prepare them for university entrance exams; giving workshops on human rights and citizenship.

Volunteer at the university outreach project "Public Policy and Human Rights", focused on public policy to homeless people.
▪ Main activities: Biweekly visits to a public shelter for homeless and vulnerable women and transsexual people. Realization of cultural activities, legal guidelines, debates on the role of women in society, identification of human rights demands.

Volunteer Exchange Participant at the EDISON Project.
▪ Main activities: developed and conducted engaging activities to teach about Brazilian culture;
taught in Czech elementary and high schools for 6 weeks; presented over 100 presentations about
Brazil to students aged 10 to 19.
